item.title: Ryan Cordell on "Where can I find people interested in collaborating on a DH startup?"
item.dc:creator: Ryan Cordell
item.description: Patrick beat me to the recommendation. We launched DHCommons earlier this month precisely to meet needs like this one. Post your project idea and browse the profiles of folks looking for collaborators! Replying to @Patrick Murray-John's post:

item.title: Patrick Murray-John on "Where can I find people interested in collaborating on a DH startup?"
item.dc:creator: Patrick Murray-John
item.description: The newly-launched DHCommons aims to be exactly the place for looking for collaborators.

item.title: zacharysdavis on "Where can I find people interested in collaborating on a DH startup?"
item.dc:creator: zacharysdavis
item.description:
I'm working on a digital humanities project and would love to find others interested in collaborating. The project is called Kanon, and we're creating a digital library platform that facilitates social annotation of classic works of literature and art. We would be grateful to have help of any kind, both technical and advisory. You can see a rough mockup here: http://kanon.lemon.ua/new/book.html

If you may be interested, or know anyone who is, or where I can find collaborators, please contact me at zacharysdavis@gmail.com or reach me on skype at zacharysdavis.

Thank you,

Zach
